			StaticText 'When you enter text in the GitLab UI, GitLab assumes the text is in the Markdown language. The text is rendered with a set of styles. These styles are called'

			[601] link '', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/raw/master/public/-/emojis/2/speak_no_evil.png'
				[602] image '', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/raw/master/public/-/emojis/2/speak_no_evil.png'
			StaticText 'patches. If someone improves your really'
			[603] link '', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/raw/master/public/-/emojis/2/snail.png'
				[604] image '', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/raw/master/public/-/emojis/2/snail.png'
			StaticText 'code, send them some'
			[605] link '', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/raw/master/public/-/emojis/2/birthday.png'
				[606] image '', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/raw/master/public/-/emojis/2/birthday.png'
			StaticText '. People'
			[607] link '', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/raw/master/public/-/emojis/2/heart.png'
				[608] image '', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/raw/master/public/-/emojis/2/heart.png'
			StaticText 'you for that.'
		[609] paragraph ''
			StaticText "If you're new to this, don't be"
			[610] link '', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/raw/master/public/-/emojis/2/fearful.png'
				[611] image '', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/raw/master/public/-/emojis/2/fearful.png'
			StaticText '. You can join the emoji'
			[612] link '', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/raw/master/public/-/emojis/2/family.png'
				[613] image '', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/raw/master/public/-/emojis/2/family.png'
			StaticText '. Just look up one of the supported codes.'
		[614] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'Consult the'
			[615] link 'Emoji Cheat Sheet', url='https://www.webfx.com/tools/emoji-cheat-sheet/'
			StaticText 'for a list of all supported emoji codes.'
			[616] link '', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/raw/master/public/-/emojis/2/thumbsup.png'
				[617] image '', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/raw/master/public/-/emojis/2/thumbsup.png'
		[618] heading 'Emojis and your operating system'
		[620] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'The previous emoji example uses hard-coded images. Rendered emojis in GitLab may be different depending on the OS and browser used.'
		[621] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'Most emojis are natively supported on macOS, Windows, iOS, Android, and fall back on image-based emojis where there is no support.'
		[622] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'On Linux, you can download'
			[623] link 'Noto Color Emoji', url='https://github.com/googlefonts/noto-emoji'
			StaticText 'to get full native emoji support. Ubuntu 18.04 (like many modern Linux distributions) has this font installed by default.'
		[624] heading 'Front matter'
		[626] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'Front matter is metadata included at the beginning of a Markdown document, preceding the content. This data can be used by static site generators like'
			[627] link 'Jekyll', url='https://jekyllrb.com/docs/front-matter/'
			StaticText ','
			[628] link 'Hugo', url='https://gohugo.io/content-management/front-matter/'
			StaticText ', and many other applications.'
		[629] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'When you view a Markdown file rendered by GitLab, front matter is displayed as-is, in a box at the top of the document. The HTML content displays after the front matter. To view an example, you can toggle between the source and rendered version of a'
			[630] link 'GitLab documentation file', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/doc/index.md'
			StaticText '.'
		[631] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'In GitLab, front matter is used only in Markdown files and wiki pages, not the other places where Markdown formatting is supported. It must be at the very top of the document and must be between delimiters.'
		[632] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'The following delimiters are supported:'
		[633] list ''
			[634] listitem ''
				ListMarker '‚Ä¢'
				[635] paragraph ''
					StaticText 'YAML ('
					[636] code ''
						StaticText '---'
					StaticText '):'
				[639] code ''
					StaticText '---'
					StaticText ''
					StaticText 'title'
					StaticText ':'
					StaticText ''
					StaticText 'About Front Matter'
					StaticText ''
					StaticText 'example'
					StaticText ':'
					StaticText ''
					StaticText ''
					StaticText 'language'
					StaticText ':'
					StaticText ''
					StaticText 'yaml'
					StaticText ''
					StaticText '---'
				[655] button ''
					[656] image ''
			[657] listitem ''
				ListMarker '‚Ä¢'
				[658] paragraph ''
					StaticText 'TOML ('
					[659] code ''
						StaticText '+++'
					StaticText '):'
				[662] code ''

					StaticText ''
					StaticText 'title'

					StaticText '='
					StaticText ''

					StaticText '[example]'
					StaticText ''

					StaticText ''
					StaticText '='
					StaticText ''
					StaticText '"toml"'
					StaticText ''
					StaticText '+++'
				[677] button ''
					[678] image ''
			[679] listitem ''
				ListMarker '‚Ä¢'

		[716] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'Other languages are supported by adding a specifier to any of the existing delimiters. For example:'

			StaticText ''
			StaticText '$title'

		[744] heading 'Inline diff'
		[746] paragraph ''
			[747] link 'View this topic in GitLab', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/doc/user/markdown.md#inline-diff'
			StaticText '.'
		[748] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'With inline diff tags, you can display'

			StaticText 'or'
			[750] code ''

			StaticText '.'

		[808] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'Math written in LaTeX syntax is rendered with'

			StaticText 'This syntax also works for the Asciidoctor'
